1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Next character sequence.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.Next
6  ( -- * Next
7    InputText,
8    Next, AbNext,
9    nextSpace,
10    nextQQ,
11
12    -- * Symbol
13    -- ** Data type
14    Symbol (..),
15    -- ** Symbol test
16    isGeneralSymbol, isPlainSymbol, isNumericSymbol, isShortSymbol,
17    -- ** Char test
18    isSymbolChar, isGeneralChar, isPlainChar, isNumericChar,
19    -- ** Next symbol
20    nextSymbol, nextSymbolPlain,
21  ) where
22
23import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol.Message  as Msg
27
28-- | Input data type.
29type InputText = String
30
31-- | Split next character sequence from input text.
32type Next a = InputText -> (InputText, a)
33
34-- | Split next character sequence from input text.
35type AbNext a = InputText -> B.Ab (InputText, a)
36
37-- Punctuations
38isQQ, isSpace :: O.Test Char
39isQQ       = (== '"')
40isSpace    = Ch.isSpace
41
42-- | Get next spaces.
43--   Space character is decided by 'Ch.isSpace'.
44--
45--   >>> nextSpace " abc"
46--   ("abc", 1)
47--
48--   >>> nextSpace " \tabc"
49--   ("abc", 2)
50--
51nextSpace :: Next Int
52nextSpace = loop 0 where
53    loop n (c:cs) | isSpace c   = loop (n + 1) cs
54    loop n cs                   = (cs, n)
55
56-- | Get next double quoted text.
57--   A single double quote ends text.
58--   A double double quote does not end text,
59--   but it is converted to double quote.
60--
61--   >>> nextQQ "abc\" def"
62--   Right (" def","abc")
63--
64--   >>> nextQQ "abc\"\"def\" ghi"
65--   Right (" ghi","abc\"def")
66--
67nextQQ :: AbNext String
68nextQQ = loop "" where
69    loop w (c:cs) | isQQ c        = qq w cs
70                  | otherwise     = loop (c:w) cs
71    loop _ _                      = Msg.quotNotEnd
72
73    qq w (c:cs)   | isQQ c        = loop (c:w) cs
74    qq w cs                       = Right (cs, reverse w)
75
76
77-- --------------------------------------------  Symbol
78
79-- ----------------------  Data type
80
81-- | Symbol class.
82--
83-- Relation between character classes and symbol classes.
84-- The char class @number'@ means Unicode number except for @0-9@.
85-- @G@ for general symbol, @P@ for plain, @N@ for numeric.
86--
87-- >   Char class   Symbol class
88-- >   ------------ -----------------
89-- >   "0-9"        ( G ) ( P ) ( N )
90-- >   "-"          ( G ) ( P ) ( N )
91-- >   letter       ( G )   P
92-- >   mark         ( G )   P
93-- >   number'      ( G )   P
94-- >   "_?"         ( G )   P
95-- >   "+"          ( G )         N
96-- >   "*=<>~"        G
97-- >   ".#"                       N
98--
99-- Partial order of symbol classes.
100--
101-- >                     ( GPN ) Common
102-- >                    /      |
103-- >           Plain ( GP )  ( GN ) Numeric
104-- >                /  |    /  |
105-- >   Short ( P.P )   |   /   |
106-- >            :      |  /    |
107-- >         General ( G )     |
108-- >            :      :     ( N ) Numeric
109-- >            :      :       :
110-- >            ................ Unknown
111
112data Symbol
113    = SymbolCommon    String           -- ^ General-plain-numeric symbol
114    | SymbolGeneral   String           -- ^ General symbol
115    | SymbolPlain     String           -- ^ Plain symbol
116    | SymbolNumeric   String           -- ^ Numeric symbol
117    | SymbolShort     String String    -- ^ Short symbol (Plain @"."@ Plain)
118    | SymbolUnknown   String           -- ^ Unknown symbol
119      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
120
121
122-- ----------------------  Symbol test
123
124-- | Test symbol is general, in other words,
125--   'SymbolCommon', 'SymbolPlain' or 'SymbolGeneral'.
126isGeneralSymbol :: O.Test Symbol
127isGeneralSymbol (SymbolCommon _)   = True
128isGeneralSymbol (SymbolPlain _)    = True
129isGeneralSymbol (SymbolGeneral _)  = True
130isGeneralSymbol _                  = False
131
132-- | Test symbol is plain, in other words,
133--   'SymbolCommon' or 'SymbolPlain'.
134isPlainSymbol :: O.Test Symbol
135isPlainSymbol (SymbolCommon _)     = True
136isPlainSymbol (SymbolPlain _)      = True
137isPlainSymbol _                    = False
138
139-- | Test symbol is numeric, in other words,
140--   'SymbolCommon' or 'SymbolNumeric'.
141isNumericSymbol :: O.Test Symbol
142isNumericSymbol (SymbolCommon _)   = True
143isNumericSymbol (SymbolNumeric _)  = True
144isNumericSymbol _                  = False
145
146-- | Test symbol is 'SymbolShort'.
147isShortSymbol :: O.Test Symbol
148isShortSymbol (SymbolShort _ _)    = True
149isShortSymbol _                    = False
150
151
152-- ----------------------  Char test
153
154-- | Test character is a symbol component.
155isSymbolChar :: O.Test Char
156isSymbolChar c = isGeneralChar c || isNumericChar c
157
158-- | Test character is a general-symbol component.
159isGeneralChar :: O.Test Char
160isGeneralChar = isCharG'
161
162-- | Test character is a plain-symbol component.
163isPlainChar :: O.Test Char
164isPlainChar = isCharP'
165
166-- | Test character is a numeric-symbol component.
167isNumericChar :: O.Test Char
168isNumericChar = isCharN'
169
170isCharGpn, isCharDigit, isCharHyphen :: O.Test Char
171isCharGpn    c  = isCharDigit c || isCharHyphen c
172isCharDigit  c  = c >= '0' && c <= '9'
173isCharHyphen c  = c == '-'
174
175isCharGp :: O.Test Char
176isCharGp c =
177    case O.majorGeneralCategory c of
178      O.UnicodeLetter    -> True
179      O.UnicodeMark      -> True
180      O.UnicodeNumber    -> True      -- include isCharDigit
181      _                  -> c == '_' || c == '?'
182
183isCharGn, isCharG, isCharN :: O.Test Char
184isCharGn c   = c == '+'
185isCharG  c   = c `elem` "*=<>~"
186isCharN  c   = c == '.' || c == '#'
187
188isCharGp', isCharP', isCharGn', isCharG', isCharN' :: O.Test Char
189isCharGp' c  = isCharGp  c || isCharHyphen c
190isCharP'     = isCharGp'
191isCharGn' c  = isCharGpn c || isCharGn c
192isCharG'  c  = isCharGp' c || isCharGn c || isCharG c
193isCharN'  c  = isCharGn' c || isCharN  c
194
195
196-- ---------------------- Next symbol
197
198-- | Get next symbol.
199nextSymbol :: Next Symbol
200nextSymbol = symbolGpn "" where
201
202    done w cs k           = (cs, k $ reverse w)
203
204    -- General and Plain and Numeric
205    symbolGpn w (c:cs)
206        | isCharGpn c     = symbolGpn (c:w) cs
207        | isCharGp  c     = symbolGp  (c:w) cs
208        | isCharGn  c     = symbolGn  (c:w) cs
209        | isCharG   c     = symbolG   (c:w) cs
210        | isCharN   c     = symbolN   (c:w) cs
211        | isSymbolChar  c     = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
212    symbolGpn w cs        = done w cs SymbolCommon
213
214    -- General and Plain
215    symbolGp w (c:cs)
216        | c == '.'        = short (reverse w) "" cs
217        | isCharGp' c     = symbolGp  (c:w) cs
218        | isCharG   c     = symbolG   (c:w) cs
219        | isSymbolChar  c     = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
220    symbolGp w cs         = done w cs SymbolPlain
221
222    -- Plain "." Plain
223    short pre w (c:cs)
224        | isCharGp' c     = short pre (c:w) cs
225        | isSymbolChar  c     = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
226    short pre w cs        = done w cs $ SymbolShort pre
227
228    -- General and Numeric
229    symbolGn w (c:cs)
230        | isCharGn' c     = symbolGn  (c:w) cs
231        | isCharG   c     = symbolG   (c:w) cs
232        | isCharN   c     = symbolN   (c:w) cs
233        | isSymbolChar  c     = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
234    symbolGn w cs         = done w cs SymbolNumeric
235
236    -- General
237    symbolG w (c:cs)
238        | isCharG' c      = symbolG   (c:w) cs
239        | isSymbolChar c      = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
240    symbolG w cs          = done w cs SymbolGeneral
241
242    -- Numeric
243    symbolN w (c:cs)
244        | isCharN' c      = symbolN   (c:w) cs
245        | isSymbolChar c      = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
246    symbolN w cs          = done w cs SymbolNumeric
247
248    -- Unknown symbol
249    symbolUnk w (c:cs)
250        | isSymbolChar c      = symbolUnk (c:w) cs
251    symbolUnk w cs        = done w cs SymbolUnknown
252
253-- | Get next plain symbol.
254nextSymbolPlain :: AbNext String
255nextSymbolPlain cs =
256    case nextSymbol cs of
257      (cs', sym) -> do w <- getSymbolPlain sym
258                       Right (cs', w)
259
260getSymbolPlain :: Symbol -> B.Ab String
261getSymbolPlain (SymbolCommon w)  = Right w
262getSymbolPlain (SymbolPlain  w)  = Right w
263getSymbolPlain _                 = Msg.expOrdSym
264
